Metadata: California's Living Marine Resources:Â A Status Report
California Department of Fish and Game/University of California Sea Grant Program

The 600 page book is meant to provide lay people and specialists alike with the best available information on the oceanic, environmental, regulatory, and socioeconomic factors that bear on the management of California's living marine resources. Chapters on the major coastal ecosystems (nearshore, offshore, and bays and estuaries) include descriptions, major issues facing fisheries managers, and management frameworks. Maps, graphs and illustrations are included.
